article.headline: Creighton 74, Arkansas-Pine Bluff 39
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Creighton's defense held Arkansas-Pine Bluff without a field goal for nearly 16 minutes as the Bluejays awakened from a sluggish first half to beat the winless Golden Lions, 74-39. Creighton scored the first 19 points in the second half to improve to 3-1 on the season. Neither team shot well in the first half. "We just made a commitment to come out, bring a lot of energy and try to get better (in the second half)," said Anthony Tolliver, who scored 10 points while his teammates shot just 8-of-27 in the first half. "It just shows what a little bit of turn-up can do for this team." Tolliver finished with 17 points and 11 rebounds, and Nate Funk and Isacc Miles each added 10 points as Creighton handed the Golden Lions (0-5) their fifth consecutive decisive loss. The Golden Lions were playing their fifth straight road game to start the season. Arkansas-Pine Bluff missed its first 16 shots after the break and didn't have a second-half field goal until Torien Noel tipped in a Jason Frierson miss with 8:14 to play. By that time, Creighton had turned a 28-16 halftime lead into a 54-19 advantage. The Golden Lions shot 7-of-24 from the field and turned the ball over nine times in the opening 20 minutes. The Bluejays built a 13-point lead after an 11-2 run highlighted by a pair of baskets by Tolliver and driving finishes by Dane Watts and Ty Morrison. The Golden Lions cut the margin to eight on a 3-pointer by Larry Williams. But Nate Funk and Tolliver scored on consecutive possessions for Creighton to push the lead to 12 at the break. The Bluejays extended the lead to 31 before the Lions scored again. "We were getting some pretty good looks and we weren't hitting them, and I thought our intensity dropped off because of that," Bluejays coach Dana Altman said. "The second half, we hit more shots and our intensity was definitely better, even though we made some mistakes." Arkansas-Pine Bluff finished the game with 24 percent shooting from the field -- the lowest of any Creighton opponent since Altman became the Bluejays' coach.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
